image.altText: A man in religious robes looks down from a balcony

props.synopsis: The new head of the Catholic church is 69, considered a moderate and was elevated to the position of cardinal by his predecessor, Pope Francis.

title.children: Cardinal Prevost named first American pope and will be known as Pope Leo XIV

image.altText: White smoke billows from a chimney against a blue sky

props.synopsis: People cheer and run through the streets of Rome towards the Vatican, as the new leader of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo XIV, makes his first appearance in St Peter's Square.

title.children: Joy sweeps St Peter's Square as Pope Leo is introduced to the faithful

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Donald Trump shake hands and make eye contact

props.synopsis: It's the first deal between the US and one of its trading partners since Donald Trump up-ended global trading relationships with his "liberation day" tariffs.

title.children: US and UK strike deal as Trump slashes tariffs on British steel, cars

image.altText: Anika Wells Amanda Rishworth Katie Gallagher Anne Aly

props.synopsis: This week in politics a record number of women entered Labor's ranks, Tim Wilson returned, Jacinta Nampijinpa Price defected to the Liberals and two party rooms deliberated who their new leaders will be.

title.children: More women in Labor than ever but top jobs still going to men

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman wearing a white blazer and black and white shirt.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has announced she will join the Liberal Party as debate continues over the party's next leader.

title.children: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price joins Liberal Party as leadership race heats up

image.altText: a composite image of two men wearing suits

props.synopsis: Two senior cabinet ministers have been dumped from Anthony Albanese's new-look ministry as factional heavyweights meet in Canberra to carve up up the 30 frontbench positions.

title.children: Cabinet ministers Mark Dreyfus, Ed Husic scrapped from new Albanese ministry

image.altText: Paramedics stand with stretches near vehicles on a road.

props.synopsis: The inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbings has heard the security control room was empty when the attack started, and when ambulances arrived the paramedics were instructed not to enter the mall.

title.children: Wrong warnings, panicked staff: Bondi inquest reveals timeline of confusion

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: Can US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent save the world from Donald Trump’s trade turmoil?

title.children: Swiss tariff crisis meeting between China and US may come to naught

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson was visibly upset as she watched a recording of her daughter’s police interview in the aftermath of the deadly beef Wellington lunch at her home.

title.children: Accused killer Erin Patterson breaks down in court at daughter's testimony

image.altText: A big hole is seen on a rooftop of a house suspected to have been damaged in Indian drone attack

props.synopsis: India says it "neutralised" Pakistan's attempts to strike military targets with drones and missiles, as fighting spreads between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title.children: Pakistan says retaliation 'increasingly certain' after downing Indian drones

image.altText: A woman sits in front of a microphone on a dimly lit stage with an emotional expression.

props.synopsis: Mechelle Turvey lost her only son "for no reason", and now his murderers have been brought to justice. This is how she turned her immense grief into a force for change.

title.children: How one mother's grief and love captured hearts across Australia

image.altText: Adam Bandt press gallery doorstop

props.synopsis: The minor party leader has officially conceded defeat in his long-held seat of Melbourne, clearing the way for the Greens to appoint a new federal captain.

title.children: Greens leader Adam Bandt concedes seat, ending 15 years in parliament

image.altText: Woman sitting on a panel show smiling

props.synopsis: Dr Allen, who served as the member for Higgins until 2022, says she knows there are difficult days ahead, but is facing this with "clarity and determination".

title.children: Former Liberal MP Katie Allen announces diagnosis of rare cancer

image.altText: Two women smile as one holds an infant to her chest

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr and Kristie Mewis welcome their first child, named Jagger Mewis-Kerr.

title.children: Sam Kerr announces birth of son with partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: A woman in a grey sweater next to the words 'come join me'

props.synopsis: From a celebrity-spruiked success to a relic of diet culture. How a changing world of nutrition led to Weight Watchers' bankruptcy.

title.children: Oprah was the face of Weight Watchers. Her exit foreshadowed the brand's bankruptcy

image.altText: A young person in handcuffs is held by two police officers in blue uniforms.

props.synopsis: NSW Police say the group drove through the night to Sydney after stealing a car from outside a gym in Victoria at about 3pm on Wednesday.

title.children: Teens and 12-year-old charged after cross-Sydney police chase

image.altText: Jennifer Aniston smiling and wearing a diamond earing.

props.synopsis: A 48-year-old man from Mississippi is accused of harassing the Friends star over two years.

title.children: Man charged with stalking Jennifer Aniston after crashing into her home

image.altText: Herbie Farnworth of the Dolphins makes a break to score

props.synopsis: Herbie Farnworth has continued his dazzling form to help the Dolphins seal a rare away win in a 20-16 triumph over bottom-placed Parramatta.

title.children: 'Banged up' Farnworth produces brilliant try in rare Dolphins away win

image.altText: people hold flags in support of the alternatice for germany party

props.synopsis: AfD's leadership welcomed the decision by saying it is an "important step towards our actual exoneration."

title.children: German spy agency pauses 'extremist' classification for AfD party

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and his Xi Jinping look towards eachother inside the kremlin

props.synopsis: The Russian president welcomed China's President Xi for talks in the Kremlin that Moscow hopes will provide a diplomatic boost for the country at a key moment in the war with Ukraine.

title.children: Xi says China will work with Russia to deal with international 'bullying'

image.altText: A man with his grandmother dressed in white.

props.synopsis: The latest escalation in violence between India and Pakistan has left the diaspora communities in Australia fearing for their families trapped in the conflict zone.

title.children: 'Feels like a tipping point': India and Pakistan diaspora grapple with Kashmir conflict

image.altText: A small circular spacecraft

props.synopsis: An out-of-control Soviet-era spacecraft will plummet back to Earth on Saturday, if the latest tracking predictions are correct. But there's still a lot experts don't know.

title.children: 'A cannonball': Soviet-era probe predicted to crash land within two days

image.altText: Backlit photo of a Dutton press conference, his silhouette centred in front of a  microphone

props.synopsis: The writing was on the wall for Peter Dutton long before Anthony Albanese fired the starter's gun on the election race that would see the Coalition decimated.

title.children: 'Children at the grown-ups' table': Liberal insiders reveal a catastrophic campaign

image.altText: Scolyer profile professor

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Professor Richard Scolyer says he may only have a few months to live as he faces his brain cancer diagnosis.

title.children: Professor Richard Scolyer shares health update as he wins major prize at book awards

image.altText: A huge truck drives along a dirt road at a mine site.

props.synopsis: The specialist coroner will seek to hold outstanding inquests as soon as possible. The appointment comes ahead of a review into the resources sector's regulator.

title.children: Queensland appoints first mining coroner amid inquest backlog

image.altText: A black and white photo showing the old school house from the side with its gothic windows and door visible and tin roof

props.synopsis: Sydney couple Mon Berger and Charlie Tutty bought a rundown 19th-century schoolhouse more than 1,000 kilometres away, with a dream to revive, restore and one day retire to the heritage-listed property.

title.children: Old schoolhouse restoration transforms piece of history in Adelaide Hills

image.altText: scenes outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Nathan Morris, who admitted he fatally stabbed his sister's boyfriend with a steak knife, has been acquitted of murder and manslaughter.

title.children: Man walks free after fatally stabbing sister's boyfriend five times

image.altText: James Johnson talks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Ten months out from the Women's Asian Cup on home soil, Football Australia is on the hunt for a new chief executive after James Johnson resigned.

title.children: Football Australia chief executive quits less than a year from Women's Asian Cup

image.altText: A person holds an iPhone with the banking apps for ANZ, Commonwealth Bank, NAB and Westpac open.

props.synopsis: The major banks post mixed profit results but NAB's boss expects house prices to continue rising this year as interest rates drop.

title.children: ANZ profit rises as NAB boss tips rate cuts and housing boom

image.altText: Unidentified man being arrested inside home

props.synopsis: Police are working to identify people captured in videos shot through windows, including four children, and say no-one should have to fear a breach of privacy in their homes.

title.children: Police allege prowler secretly filmed 40 people inside their homes

image.altText: A group of rugby league fans celebrate

props.synopsis: It will be in a new city under a new name, but the Bears' return to the NRL is a just reward for the diehard fans who kept the red and black colours alive during a period in the wilderness.

title.children: 'I never gave up hope': Bears faithful joyous as NRL return confirmed

image.altText: An adult tiger lying on its belly on the ground under tree trunks.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne Zoo tiger has undergone two hours of dental surgery, in an episode unlikely to be soon forgotten by those involved.

title.children: What's it like to do dental work on a tiger?

image.altText: Little penguins on a beach, lit by red light.

props.synopsis: After an "unprecedented" drop in numbers, adult little penguins have begun returning to an east coast Tasmanian town, with scientists predicting winter breeding is to come.

title.children: 'They're back, I can hear them': Community's relief at return of little penguins
